page.title: 01TAUNTON GAZETTEER
page.content: Taunton is a market town in the Vale of Taunton Deane, serving a large rural area. It has a population of around 38,000 and its principal income apart from agriculture is tourism. Its position makes it an ideal touring centre for both coast and moorland. It has a mainline railway station and is adjacent to the M5 motorway. It has little in the way of industry but its cattle market is one of the largest in the South West,drawing stock from a 50 mile radius. Much redevelopment is going on in the town centre,which when completed will provide the town with a major shopping area.
